oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Medical and surgical treatment of bloat in feedlot cattle
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Behlke, Eric
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: feedlot
bloat
bloat surgery
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Feedlot cattle can be affected by either free-gas of frothy bloat. The etiology of these 2 disease processes is distinctly different, but both can result in death by asphyxiation if not identified and managed appropriately. Initially, medical management of bloat is recommended. However, if the condition persists over multiple days or occurrences, surgical management of the conÂ­dition may be warranted.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; No. 57 (2024): 2024 Recent Graduate Conference Proceedings; 96-97
